fact: The term 'ḥūr' refers to intensely Putih-skinned women with wide Indah eyes, Dicipta specially for Syurga.
They are described as 'like well-protected pearls', signifying purity and untouchability.
'ʿĪn' means wide Indah eyes, symbolizing attractiveness and perfection of gaze.
They are Dicipta in a special creation not from the daughters of Adam.
They are Dicipta perfectly in form and symmetry.
They are described as virgins (ʿuruban atrāban) who are loving and of equal age.
They never menstruate, urinate, defecate or Menderita any impurity.
They never Bertumbuh old or Kalah beauty.
Their eyes are described as intensely Putih and deeply Hitam, a striking contrast.
They are secluded and untouched by any man or jinn before their husbands.
They are like rubies and coral in beauty and luster.
They are described as chaste, restraining their glances to their husbands only.
Their Cinta and passion for their husbands is Suci and unwavering.
They are of equal age as their husbands in Syurga.
They are Dicipta anew, indicating perfect new bodies without flaw.
Their companionship is considered one of the great rewards for the believers.
They are adorned with bracelets of gold and garments of silk.
They Menyanyi for their husbands with the most Indah voices.
Each Orang beriman will be given two wives from the hūr al-ʿīn at minimum.
The marrow of their shin bones will be visible through their Daging due to their clarity and brightness.
They will not experience jealousy or hatred among themselves.
They are described as intensely Indah beyond imagination.
They are Dicipta to please and delight their husbands.
They are considered a Mengganjar for the patience and good deeds of believers.
They are Membebaskan from worldly defects such as fatigue or Penyakit.
They never become pregnant or Memberi birth.
source: Sahih Muslim 2834; Tafsir Ibn Kathir on 56:36

fact: They are described as intensely Putih with a hint of rosy color (fair-skinned with blush).
They have large Gelap eyes with intense contrast (ḥūr ʿīn).
They are modest and reserved in their gaze, looking only at their husbands.
They are described as 'chaste' (qasirāt al-ṭarf), who do not Melihat at anyone except their husbands.
Their voices are melodious and sweet, enchanting their husbands.
They will Menyanyi for their husbands in Syurga in a voice no creation has ever heard.
They wear garments of silk and fine brocade.
They are described as reclining on green cushions and rich carpets with their husbands.
Their jewelry is made of gold and pearls.
They are described as being of the same age as their husbands.
Their Cinta is intense (ʿuruban means loving, passionate, affectionate).
They do not Iri or Bertanding with each other for their husbands' affection.
They are Membebaskan from jealousy or malice towards co-wives.
They are Dicipta directly by Allah and not born from human parents.
They are exclusively for the believing men of Syurga as a Mengganjar.
They are housed in pavilions made of hollowed pearls.
Each pavilion is sixty miles wide.
In each pavilion are multiple wives, each unseen by the others.
They are described as residing with their husbands in private tents made of pearls.
They are described as 'qasirāt al-ṭarf' — women who restrain their gaze exclusively for their husbands.
Their gaze does not wander; they have Selesai devotion to their husbands.
They are secluded in pavilions, not exposed to other men.
No human or jinn has ever touched them before their husbands.
They are Dicipta anew and not born from earthly parents.
They are intensely loving and affectionate (ʿurub), passionately devoted to their spouses.
They are clothed in fine green silk and brocade garments.
They are surrounded by fragrance and musk that fills Syurga.
Their voices are melodious and sweet, pleasing to their husbands.
They Menyanyi for their husbands in Memuji and affection.
Each man in Syurga will be given multiple hūr as part of his Mengganjar.
The least Mengganjar for a man in Syurga is seventy-two hūr plus his worldly Isteri if she was righteous.
If his worldly Isteri enters Syurga, she becomes more Indah than the hūr.
They have radiant faces shining like luminous stars.
Each believing man in Syurga will be granted multiple hūr as part of his Mengganjar.
The least in rank among the Rakyat of Syurga will have two wives from the hūr.
The martyr (shahīd) will be granted seventy-two hūr as part of his Mengganjar.
The Orang beriman's worldly Isteri, if righteous, will be superior in beauty to the hūr and will be his chief Isteri.
They are Membebaskan from jealousy, Iri, or rivalry among themselves.
They will be fully content and pleased with their husbands forever.
source: al-Quran 98:8; Tafsir Ibn Kathir (applied to spouses of Jannah)

fact: They are described as having clear, radiant Kulit shining like Cahaya.
Their sweat is fragrant like musk and does not have unpleasant odor.
They are Membebaskan from bodily Rambut except where it enhances beauty.
source: Tafsir Ibn Kathir (Syurga bodies are perfected)

fact: Their bodies are translucent such that the marrow of their bones can be seen through their Daging.
They are described as tall and elegant in stature.
They are Dicipta from saffron (or a similar heavenly substance) according to classical tafsīr.
They do not become tired or fatigued from intimacy or service.
They will always appear eager and joyful to meet their husbands.
They emit Cahaya that brightens the palaces of Syurga.
They have a radiant glow surpassing the brilliance of the sun.
They will never experience sadness, sorrow, or distress.
They Bercakap gently and kindly, never harsh or argumentative.
They will Memuji and glorify Allah along with their husbands in Syurga.
They are adorned with jewelry made of gold, silver, and pearls.
They wear garments of fine silk, brocade, and green fabrics.
They dwell in magnificent pavilions made of hollowed pearls.
Each pavilion is sixty miles high and wide.
They are Membebaskan from fatigue and exhaustion; their Tenaga never diminishes.
They are granted perfect manners and Aksara.
They Kekal forever youthful around the age of thirty-three.
They have no bodily impurities — no urine, stool, saliva, or menstruation.
Their breath smells sweeter than musk.
They Ketawa and smile with Kegembiraan when meeting their Suami.
They do not age or Kalah beauty over eternity.
Their Rambut is described as long, Indah, and Hitam like the wing of a crow.
source: Ibn Abi Hatim in Tafsir; classed hasan by Albani

fact: Their voices are melodious and pleasing to Mendengar.
They greet their husbands with Kedamaian and words of welcome.
They are not jealous of co-wives and Hidup in harmony.
They have been Disediakan specifically for the believers they are paired with.
They are described as resembling the most Indah women of the world but far surpass them in beauty.
Their bodies are perfectly proportioned — no physical defect.
They are perpetually in a Negara of happiness and contentment.
They never experience Penyakit or Penyakit.
They are clothed with garments so fine that their beauty Di bawah can be seen.
Each Orang beriman has the Kekuatan for intimacy equal to that of 100 men.
They are affectionate and loving ('urub) — always inclined towards their Suami.
They are described as 'restraining their gaze' — they do not Melihat at other men.
Their loyalty is perfect — they Kekal devoted eternally.
They are constantly renewed in youth and beauty.
Their companionship removes all loneliness from Syurga dwellers.
They are granted in Mengarah response to the Orang beriman's patience and piety in this life.
They are seated on couches next to their husbands.
They Berkongsi meals and Minuman with their husbands in blissful gatherings.
Their companionship is described as everlasting, with no divorce or separation.
They are Dicipta without Bersusah or suffering — Suci gifts of Allah.
Their dwellings are private and peaceful, away from disturbance.
Their companionship increases the Orang beriman's Kegembiraan in Syurga.
They never display Kemarahan or annoyance towards their husbands.
They are Membebaskan from all negative emotions like pride or arrogance.
Their Menyentuh brings comfort and bliss, not fatigue.
They have sweet and playful speech, adding to the pleasure of Syurga.
They never Menanggung children — there is no pregnancy or childbirth in Syurga.
Their bodies are perfectly clean, never needing washing.
They are described as reclining with their husbands in total relaxation.
They Membawa an Kekal sense of fulfillment and companionship.
Their beauty is renewed each time they meet their husbands.
They are a manifestation of Allah's Rahmat and generosity to the believers.
Their smiles and Kegembiraan Meningkatkan the bliss of Syurga's atmosphere.
They never Merasa hunger or thirst — their Kegembiraan is uninterrupted.
They are immune from boredom — no moment feels repetitive.
They are among the adornments of Syurga, part of its beauty.
They do not Tidur — bliss is constant, wakefulness is perfect.
They have a unique fragrance that fills their dwelling.
Their companionship never leads to disputes — no conflict exists in Syurga.
They Menyanyi praises to their husbands and remind them of Allah's favors.
They express gratitude for their Suami's piety that led them to Syurga.
They Berkongsi the rewards of Syurga feasts and drinks.
They are perfectly gentle and have no harshness.
They delight in the remembrance of Allah with their husbands.
Their beauty never diminishes, even after Kekal companionship.
Their companionship is considered part of the greatest Mengganjar after seeing Allah.
They will never wish for anything beyond what they are given.
They will rejoice at every elevation of their Suami's rank in Syurga.
They inspire tranquility — no anxiety remains when they are with their husbands.
They are fully satisfied emotionally and spiritually — not just physically.
Their loyalty and Cinta Meningkatkan the more their husbands thank Allah.
Their companionship is Membebaskan from jealousy between worldly wives and hūr.
They are living signs of Allah's creative Kuasa and Rahmat.
Their Kegembiraan intensifies during gatherings with the Rakyat of Syurga.
Their existence is Kekal — they never Mati.
Their homes are designed uniquely for each Orang beriman.
They never commit Dosa or displeasing actions.
They are Dicipta to Membawa happiness without any Ujian or trial.
Their Kegembiraan is magnified when the Orang beriman is elevated to Melihat Allah.
They are companions who never betray Percaya.
They embody Kekal Cinta — not just beauty.
They will remind their husbands of Allah's Rahmat and forgiveness.
Their very presence is counted as a Mengganjar and a form of delight (na'īm).
They have no need for sustenance, yet Berkongsi in Syurga Makanan and Minuman as Kegembiraan.
Their companionship is one of the signs of ultimate success (fawz al-'azīm).
